conbody.p: Look ahead/behind in phonex allows matching based on adjacent elements. The elements matched by the look ahead-beind groups will not be included in the returned value. Look ahead groups will start with the sequence (?> while look behind groups will start with the sequence (?<.
One case where this feature is useful is when searching for patterns medially within transcriptions. For example, to seach for all word-medial consonants:(?<\w)\c(?>\w)

This example has main parts:
(?<\w) look behind the current element and match if it is a consonant or vowel
\c match if the current element is a consonant
(?>\w) look ahead of the current element and match if it is a consonant or vowel
